content.description: Climb up the moderate angle slab on the backside of Smiley boulder.
content.protection: Bouldering Pad: The landing is good although sliding down the slab on your hands and knees would be a bad idea.
content.location: Slab on the backside of the Smiley boulder.

content.description: Starts on Smiley, bust up and right to a slim gaston crack. Get your foot up on the start and top out straight up.
The areaÂ’s namesake and a must do. Start on rail then find your way out left to positive hold. From there move up face on progressively better holds to easy slab top out.
content.protection: Bouldering Pad: Just need one for this beauty. Excellent landing.
content.location: Obvious problem up face of the tall boulder you come to when entering the Smiley area.

content.description: Stand start matched on the sloper and move right using two crimps before slapping the top sloper of the nose feature.  Continue moving right to a good undercling, set the left foot and heel hook the right foot and go for the jug at the lip of the boulder.
content.protection: Multiple pads, and a good spotter.   The landing from the crux isn't great, a spotter should be positioned to keep the climber from tumbling into the pit formed by the fallen tree and the sloping landing boulders.
content.location: The nose looking feature on the left side of the Smiley Face boulder.

content.description:
Boulder is left of smiley, between rock and cheese grater.

 Start: Right on diagonal sloping edge that points right. Left on sharpest little crimp @ gretna. Feet on the bar below you. Move deep into the cheese grater, gastogne on edge then very high right foot on sloping seam. Rock right and up and catch small 3 finger intermediate or if you can reach, straight up to great bar. Multitude of tiny edges and sidepulls if you can make it work. V3-V4 climbing on awesome incut crimps as you flow up past any hope of a decent landing, so send it

 Would be a fantastic climb if it werent for the chance of potato peeling at the start. V6 if you can just reach the bar.

 (Infrequently climbed..)
content.protection: One pad for the start, maybe halfpad or a shirt so you dont scrape your back. pad once you move past crux. Have a good spotter above/below you.

content.description:
Light Your Mind climbs the tall vertical face left and around the corner of the Smiley problem.  It starts standing with a tricky long move to small crimp, which is the crux.  Pick your way up crispy edges to a high top out.  The rock quality on this portion of the boulder is not the best on this line, the start hold has broken since the first ascent.  It may be necessary to "Light Your Mind" up with a certain substance to get into a head space where the height is not an issue, if you're into that sort of thing.   

  It is possible to avoid the tall top out by swinging around right onto the Smiley slab top out by using the large jug on the arete mid way up.  Or add some length and a V grade onto the problem by starting the Smiley problem and moving left around the arete.
content.location: The tall vertical face of thin edges around the left arete from the heavily chalked Smiley problem.

content.description:
Stand start the obvious arete to the left of 'Nose Picker'. Start left hand on a good side pull on the left of the arete and right on a small crimp on the right side. Pick some feet and make a long move to the good hold up and right, work your way to the good holds on the top. 

  Looks like a sit start is possible starting in the corner left of the arete. Im sure it has been done, I have not tried it however.
content.location: On the Smiley Boulder left of the obvious nose feature called 'Nose Picker' stand start the short arete.
